intro: Achyrospermum laterale, commonly known as the silverleaf groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, round seeds. Achyrospermum laterale is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
